title: Ilsoap in the news!
content:
Well, not exactly...

[url=http://www.msnbc.msn.com/id/19741740/]www.msnbc.msn.com/id/19741740/[/url]

Aren't those little plush toys based off of artwork he did for the Club Penguin site? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/posted-pics/XkyRauhKeenLogo.png[/img]

title: Re: Ilsoap in the news!
content:
Possible. Link to the ones on Club Penguin?____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: sure
content: Here's the [url=http://www.clubpenguin.com/clubpenguinshop/index.html]Club Penguin Shop[/url]... Looks like Ilsoap's work.

title: Re: sure
content:
I always knew he'd make it big involving penguins.-----------------------------------
[url=http://youtube.com/watch?v=izxrocVNVOk]Dnde Esta Jeff? [/url]
Take a look at these hands! The hands speaks. The hand of a government man.

title: Re: sure
content:
It certainly looks like his work -- check out those eyes! I'm pretty sure it's his. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img] 3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
